TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ModelUIElement3D extends System.Windows.UIElement3D

Docs.summary: Renders a 3-D model that supports input, focus, and events.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ModelUIElement3D is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](../Topic/.NET%20Framework%20Versions%20and%20Dependencies.md).
## Examples The following example shows how to create two cubes using the ModelUIElement3D class:
[!code-xml[ContainerModelSample#Viewport3D](../../add/codesnippet/Xaml/ContainerModelSample/Window1.xaml#viewport3d)]
The cubes respond to the mouse down event through the following event handlers:
[!CODE [CodeOnlyBinding#Cube1MouseDown](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CodeOnlyBinding#cube1mousedown)] [!CODE [CodeOnlyBinding#Cube2MouseDown](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CodeOnlyBinding#cube2mousedown)]
For the complete sample, see [Handling Events in 3-D Sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=159992) .
